history.content: I did 170+127+Math113 last semester. It's definitely doable with regards to workload, though I did wish I had more time for the 127 material, which can be quite dense. Note there is a bit of overlap between 170 and 127 and between 127 and 110, which may help.

children.subject:
Was it very intense workload (in comparison to other combinations of 3 technicals)? Did you also take any classes that really helped (ie strong cs70 foundation, etc.)?

Thanks so much by the way!

I'm taking them together now with EE 229B (coding theory - basically a math class). It's doable, but a pretty high workload, mainly because of the unrelenting problem sets. I don't have much time to absorb the content beyond whatever understanding I get from doing the homework and going to discussion, and I wish I did. I think any two of those is fine, but a third is probably too much unless you've got a good level of mathematical maturity. I'd recommend 110 over 127 since 110 will help you later in 127 and other math-heavy classes.

FWIW, I tried taking 127 three semesters ago (Fall 2017) after 16AB and 54 and found myself vastly underprepared for it and dropped. I took 110 the next semester and taught 2 semesters of EE 16A CSM sections, and this semester I came in a lot more confident in my linear algebra background. I think 16AB were too fast-paced for me to be able to internalize the content at the level 127 demands, and I've talked to others who feel the same. I'd really recommend 110 before 127 based on personal experience if your linear algebra feels shaky at all.

history.content:
Hi,

is 170 and 127 doable together? Would adding 110 be way too much or something that I could try out (maybe for the first few weeks to see if it's okay and then drop out if it's too much workload) or is it just close to impossible?
history.subject: CS 170 + EECS 127 (+ Math 110)
